file_content.text: Looking for Needles, are you? I'm afraid he's long gone, my friend.
Let's see those hands, nice and slow.
Freeze! Don't move!
Don't worry, I won't give you any trouble. I wouldn't stand a chance fighting you.
So, I won't. Instead, let me make a suggestion.
Tell me where Needles went, and you might live.
Start talking.
I'll need more of a guarantee than that, I think.
I'm afraid those were your last words, "friend."
No Needles, no mercy.
Wait! I could be a great help to you!
I'll tell you everything you need to know about Needles. But in exchange, you have to let me go.
You seem to know an awful lot about my mission here.
How do you know my objective?
You're wearing a Havoc Squad insignia and searching Needles's files. It doesn't take a great mind to put the two together.
You're in no position to bargain.
This isn't a negotiation.
No, I'm in no position to fight. I'm in an excellent position to bargain. I have information you need, it's as straightforward as that.
Not a chance.
You and I are both soldiers, yes? Coincidence makes us enemies, but that's no reason we can't come to an honorable agreement.
It's simple. Let me live, and I will tell you everything. Kill me, and you'll learn nothing.
Come in, Lieutenant. This is Sergeant Dorne. Do not trust this man--I served with him in the Empire. His name is Thorus.
What? Who is that, who are you talking to? Dorne? D--Dorne, is that you?
Thorus is a mass murderer, Lieutenant. A war criminal.
I'm listening, Sergeant. Go on.
Keep talking.
A mass murderer, huh?
Oh, really?
Criminal or not, I need his intel.
That doesn't matter.
Military actions against civilian populations are explicitly unlawful, as defined in the Treaty of Coruscant.
During my time in Imperial service, Thorus ordered the executions of hundreds of civilian non-combatants and full-scale bombings of unarmed populations.
Furthermore, these actions were committed in circumvention of direct orders from Imperial Command.
I am a soldier! I--I do what I must to achieve my objectives! Just like you, Lieutenant.
I don't kill civilians, you Imp scum.
We're nothing alike.
Please, listen! I'll tell you everything, everything I know!
Tell me about Needles, and I'll forget what Dorne said.
Then start talking.
Unless you want to tell me something interesting, I'm just going to start shooting.
You're boring me. Don't.
Whatever you want! I'll tell you anything!
Needles is doing experiments on the rakghouls. He wants to understand their disease, t--to turn it into a weapon.
He--he left here a few hours ago. He said he was visiting some "friends" in the ruins of an old transport station, to get more samples.
Keep going--what else can you tell me?
Go on.
I'm going to need a lot more detail, here.
Samples? Friends?
R--rakghouls. He needs more t--to continue his research. He won't say who his "friends" are, but they supplied the rakghouls.
Is that all you've got for me?
That--that's everything. That's all I know.
I've given you what you wanted. Now what about me?
Welcome to your execution, pal.
Now, you pay for your crimes.
You'd know better than I would, Sergeant. What should I do here?
Dorne, what do you recommend?
I respectfully suggest you discharge your weapon into Thorus's skull, Lieutenant.
No! This isn't fair!
The discussion ends now.
It's justice. [Kill Thorus]
If you're still recording, Sergeant, now would be a good time to stop.
Dorne disagrees. [Kill Thorus]
There seems to be some kind of signal interference, Lieutenant. Under Code 35-B, I'm cutting the connection to prevent signal interception.
I'll meet you back at the SAR office, Lieutenant. Dorne out.
No!
Since you helped me, you're free to go--for now.
I'll spare you this time.
You've bought your life.
I'm glad we could work out an arrangement. Farewell, friend.
I'll see you at HQ, Lieutenant. Dorne out.
